columns.text: In this exercise, we will identify the rate we are paying in a one-year loan of $10,000 with an interest rate of 9.8% plus two points, wherein one point refers to 1% of the loan amount.

In this calculation, we will consider the following details from the problem:

| Particulars   |            |
|---------------|------------|
| Present value | $10,000.00 |
| Interest rate | 9.8%       |
| Period        | 1 (year)   |

First off, we will determine the future value of the loan.

The future value represents the value of an amount at a future date after considering the present value multiplied by the rate and period factor.

The future value can be calculated using the following formula:

$$ \begin{aligned}
FV &=PV\times\left(1 + r\right)^{t}
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$FV$, which refers to future value\
$PV$, which means the present value\
$t$, which represent the period\
$r$, which indicate the discount rate

Next, we will determine the present value or the amount receive from the loan.

Since the loan requires two points deducted on the loan outset, we will deduct two points to determine the net amount received. If 1 point equals 1% of the loan amount, the points required to deduct are 2% of the loan amount.

We will consider the following equation in calculating the net received from the loan:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Net Amount Received} &=\text{Loan's amount}\times\left(1 - \text{Percentage of points}\right)
\end{aligned}$$

Let's now calculate the net amount received from the loan.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Net Amount Received} &=\$10,000\times\left(1 - 0.02\right)
\\[5pt]
&=\$10,000\times0.98
\\[5pt]
&= \boxed{\$9,800}
\end{aligned}$$

As can be seen in our calculation, the net amount received from the loan after deducting two points is $9,800.
Finally, considering the net amount received as the present value and the future value calculated for the previous steps, we will now calculate the loan rate.

In finding the rate, we will use the spreadsheet function Rate.

The rate function in the spreadsheet is a financial function that calculates the rate of a loan considering the present value, future value, and the period of the loan.

The rate function can be used in the spreadsheet with the following syntax:

$$\begin{aligned}
RATE&=(nper,pmt,pv,[fv],[type]) \\
\end{aligned}$$


Where:

$nper$, which refers to the period\
$pmt$, which means the constant payment\
$pv$, which represent the present value\
$fv$, the future value\
$type$, which indicates the basis of the calculation, either year-end or beginning of the year

Let's now calculate the rate we're paying on the loan.

!['slader'](https://slader-solution-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/d08265f9-ab9e-43bf-b583-0e93c56d357e-1643481296032800.png)


Based on our calculation, the rate we're paying on the loan considering the present value and the future value is 12.04%.
To conclude, if we consider the two points due onset of the loan, the rate we are paying is 12.04%.
